pageContext.description:
An incomplete copper alloy dagger of Bronze Age date (1500-800 BC). The object is composed of a tapering blade which is lenticular in section. The blade tapers to a broken point at it lower aspect and an integral rectangular shaft at its upper end. The tang and bade ends are missing due to old breaks. Both cutting edges are irregular and heavily abraded. There are no remnants of a hilt plate.



The metal is dark to light green with a heavily pitted and abraded patina.



Similar examples can be seen on the Portable Antiquities Database: Unique ID: WILT-B91985, Unique ID: LANCUM-3BEC10, Unique ID: CPAT-3A15F5
